intro: Syngonanthus pakaraimensis, commonly known as the Pakaraima grass, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Venezuela. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow leaves. The plant is adapted to the cool, moist climate of its mountainous habitat, often growing in rocky or well-drained soils. It produces small, clustered inflorescences with bisexual flowers, typical of the grass family. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
